li.label: soft compliance
li.description: A polite system prompt flickered over everything: "Thank you for your cooperation." The world felt like it was waiting for my next click.

li.text: The simulation was a sham, what a surprise!
If the world is fake, at least it says please and thank you.
The UI tried to hide its math. It blinked at the wrong Hertz.
The polite overlay felt like someone knocking on the inside of the screen.
Even the fake interface could have used fewer flourishes.

li.label: fight-or-flight seams
li.description: In the middle of a panic break the walls duplicated, HUD elements desynced, and a dozen exit arrows pointed nowhere.

li.text: Even the panic was scripted. Figures.
I made a to-do list for every ghost wall just in case.
The exits were probably just observation slits for whoever's watching.
The surge of fear at least felt honest.
Hey, at least I got a cardio session out of my existential crisis.

li.label: hollow stroll
li.description: During the sad wander, the horizon repeated like a bad screensaver. Each step felt like walking across the debug room.

li.text: Of course the sky was a jpeg. Why wouldn't it be?
The only honest thing here was the emptiness.
Even my footsteps sounded aftermarket.
I could feel the speakers hum behind the stars.
I should warn the others gently, before their sky folds too.

li.label: shattered UI
li.description: Rage broke through the interface. Health bars bled into the air; the world stuttered between targets.

li.text: Nice touch: the hit sparks looked extra fake when I started swinging.
The UI tearing was pretty. Shame about the screaming.
Frames dropped; fists landed. Felt good.
Even my tantrum was just another animation state.
Turns out the only thing softer than me was the floor texture.

li.label: burned masking layer
li.description: Fire licked the air and peeled back the colour grading. For a moment, the fake shadows looked honest.

li.text: At least flames render correctly in any reality.
The glow almost made the apocalypse cozy.
Fire stripped away the clutter. Simple, pure.
If the world is fake, I deserve the best seat by the fire.
Great, even the arson was part of the script.
